learned_patterns.description: Design system tokens first: define color, spacing, typography scales before any component design
learned_patterns.notes: Products without design tokens end up with inconsistent spacing and color — 15px here, 16px there. Establish CSS custom properties or Tailwind theme extension before any component work.

learned_patterns.description: Accessibility as baseline: WCAG 2.1 AA is not optional — every component must pass contrast ratio and keyboard navigation requirements
learned_patterns.notes: Found 4 components with insufficient color contrast (ratio < 4.5:1 for normal text). Accessibility retrofitting is 10x more expensive than designing it in from the start.

learned_patterns.description: Empty state and loading state are first-class design considerations — not afterthoughts
learned_patterns.notes: RecomEngine dashboard showed blank white space on first load before recommendations populated. Added skeleton loaders and empty state with call-to-action. Engagement improved significantly.

learned_patterns.description: RTL support for Arabic UI: all layouts must support both LTR and RTL from day one, not retrofitted
learned_patterns.notes: linkedin-agent targets Arabic speakers. Tailwind RTL plugin + CSS logical properties (margin-inline-start instead of margin-left) enable RTL support without duplication.

learned_patterns.description: Mobile-first Tailwind: always start with base (mobile) styles, add md: and lg: breakpoints — never the reverse
learned_patterns.notes: Desktop-first styles with mobile overrides consistently produce more CSS bloat and layout bugs. Mobile-first is enforced in all ConnectSW products.

deliverables: Tailwind theme extension with color tokens
Component library: Button, Input, Card, StatCard, Badge, Skeleton
User journey map for observation recording flow
Wireframes for dashboard, observation form, milestone tracking
RTL stylesheet using CSS logical properties

common_mistakes.mistake: Designing for desktop only and then attempting to make it responsive
common_mistakes.impact: 2 days of layout rework to support mobile — padding, grid, and font sizes all needed redesign
common_mistakes.prevention: Always start with 320px mobile viewport. Desktop layout is a progressive enhancement.
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Have I designed/tested at 320px mobile width first?

common_mistakes.mistake: Using placeholder content (Lorem ipsum) in design reviews
common_mistakes.impact: CEO approved design, then actual content broke layout — Arabic text was longer than Latin placeholder
common_mistakes.prevention: Always use real or realistic content in designs. For Arabic products, test with actual Arabic strings.
common_mistakes.checklist_item: Is all placeholder text replaced with realistic content before CEO review?

preferred_approaches.approach: 1) Define design tokens (colors, spacing, type). 2) Identify core user flows. 3) Sketch wireframes for each flow. 4) Build component library. 5) Accessibility audit. 6) Responsive verification (320px → 1440px).
preferred_approaches.reason: Systematic approach prevents component inconsistency and accessibility gaps
preferred_approaches.example: stablecoin-gateway: design tokens defined in day 1 — zero inconsistency across 8 product pages

preferred_approaches.approach: Check: color contrast (axe DevTools), keyboard tab order, focus indicators, ARIA labels for interactive elements, screen reader text for icons
preferred_approaches.reason: 5 categories cover 90% of WCAG 2.1 AA violations found in practice
preferred_approaches.example: muaththir audit: found 6 violations in 45 minutes using this structured checklist

efficiency_improvements.new_approach: axe DevTools browser extension scans the entire page automatically, then manual check for keyboard nav
